title: Mozambique: PM Wants Speedy Improvements in EDM and Post Office
text:
South Africa: 50 Day Countdown to Chile 
Jessen, who was already a member of the Post Office board, takes over as chairperson from Luis Rego, who had held the job for seven years. 
“It is important to undertake a diagnosis and draw up, in three months, a development strategy aligned with the government's Five Year Programme, conducive to improving the performance of these public companies”, said Rosario. 
The challenge facing EDM, he said, “is to supply good quality, safe and reliable electricity, so as to make the company a reference point at national, regional and international level”. 
“EDM must continue rural and urban electrification, improving its internal organization and management so as to raise its financial capacity, and guaranteeing new investments with the participation of national and international partners”, Rosario added. 
As for the Post Office, the Prime Minister called for taking advantage of the post office branches scattered across to country “to promote financial inclusion”. He was referring to a longstanding project to set up a post office bank, aimed particularly at rural areas. 
The new chairperson, he added, also faced the challenge of “improving the products offered by the Post Office, incorporating innovation so that these are quicker, more secure and preferred by the public”. Mozambique
